Experiment Method.Assay Method: Co-incubation and analysis of α-synuclein binding to synaptic membranes using brain cytosol

Material used.Material Name: Cytosolic extract from human brain tissue
Material used.Description: The study uses co-incubation of α-synuclein with or without brain cytosol and analyzes its binding to synaptic membranes.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutant α-synuclein exhibits impaired membrane binding compared to wild-type, which is mitigated by brain cytosol.
A53T mutant α-synuclein exhibits impaired membrane binding compared to wild-type, which is mitigated by brain cytosol.
E46K mutant α-synuclein exhibits impaired membrane binding compared to wild-type, which is mitigated by brain cytosol.

Biological replicates.Description: The number of biological replicates is not explicitly stated in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: The number of technical replicates is not explicitly stated in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein is used as a positive control for membrane binding.

Basic negative control.Description: The use of a negative control is not explicitly stated in the literature.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The statistical analysis method is not explicitly stated in the literature.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal membrane binding activity of α-synuclein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Impaired membrane binding activity of α-synuclein.

Approved assay.Description: The study uses a standard approach to analyze the binding properties of α-synuclein mutants, which is relevant for understanding their role in Parkinson's disease.
